summary:
Victor Sonna (b. 1977) is a visual artist born in Yaoundé, Cameroon and now living and working in the Netherlands. He graduated from Design Academy Eindhoven and St. Joost School of Art & Design in 2008. 

Sonna’s artistic practice is formed and informed by his genealogy. Negotiating between Cameroon and the Netherlands and constantly having to reinvent himself in these radically different socio-cultural contexts, means he is occupied with a struggle between holding onto his African roots on one hand, and assimilating into his European home on the other. His personal diasporic experience of being in-between cultures is always present in his work and he is deeply touched by what occurs in-between things. Much of his work is born from tensions arising in-between worlds, cultures, and styles, resulting in artworks that de-familiarise and test the boundaries. Notions of identity and belonging are questioned through his artistic exploration of the spaces in-between “being” and “becoming”, past and present, and Africa and the West. 

Recent solo-exhibitions include: Beyond Echo (Out of the Fire, Dak'Art, La Biennale de Dakar, Senegal) and 1525 (Van Abbemuseum, The Netherlands). Upcoming: Stoel neemt Stelling (Centraal Museum, Utrecht, September 23, 2023 - January 14, 2024)

Grants & prizes: Werkbijdrage Bewezen Talent, Mondrian Fund; Winner Best book designs 2020 for Victor Sonna. 1525.

projects.title: Anatomy of Identity
projects.description:
Even though you have no idea where you’re going, know at least where you come from. Through conflicts, we are getting to know ourselves and we start doubting the past. As an immigrant, I am fascinated by the question of integration, observing a continuous role-playing between ‘being’ and ‘becoming’. My origins and my identity are in an ongoing state of tension. Something has to crumble first before it can be built anew.

In my view, the dynamics of cultural identity do not only show through conflicts, with cultural differences also functioning as a kind of mold in which new forms are being created. A form and a copy of that form in space.

projects.title: Matisse Experience - handicap workshop
projects.description:
The Matisse Experience is a workshop given by Victor Sonna to confront people with boundaries  elderly or disabled persons experience.
The damaged life is displayed by means of everyday utilities. Everything around us can just as easily breakdown, change or disappear altogether. Consequently, everything that we perceive as being firm, grounded and balanced, is in fact just ephemeral, fragile and transitory.

projects.title: Humanize the Unhuman
projects.description:
Humanize the Unhuman - Smart Health

Design often aims for utopian idealism by creating symbols of the perfect life. Victor Sonna challanges this. Instead of ignoring the less perfect aspects of life, design should acknowledge them and integrate them into the creative process. Humanize the Unhuman shows the process of design through tentative research.

projects.title: Humanae
projects.description:
The interior of the Phillips Music Hall will function as a context for the group exhibition 'Humanae' created and curated by Victor Sonna. Our society asks for smart solutions in the field of health. Technology is often mentioned as the solution for problems related to health. Technology will be part of our society. But men and machine do not always go hand in hand. 

Humanae is about a better understanding of the physical world, looking for interesting paradoxes and contrasts. A creative generation that aims to have visitors experience that resetting our mental mind=sets can lead to new ethics and aesthetics. Ranging from re-contextualizing familiar objects and materials by Victor Sonna to revealing Maps of Cancer Care by Renee Scheepers, re-experiencing living by Niek van der Heijden and re-imagining organisms by Nacho Carbonell.

projects.title: Paradise Reset
projects.description:
Paradise Reset is about traveling beyond borders, looking for interesting paradoxes and contrasts. 
A creative generation that aims to let visitors experience that resetting our mental modems can lead to new ethics and aesthetics. Ranging from recontextualizing familiar objects and materials by Victor Sonna to reanimating stopmotion films by Niels Hoebers, redefining collaborations by Jules van den Langenberg, refabricating textile By Borre, reshaping matter by Sander Wassink, re-experience earth by Harm Rensink, redrawing collaborations by Emiel Arts and reimagine organisms by Nacho Carbonell.

projects.title: Attribute of Tomorrow & True Colors
projects.description: In 2009 and  2010, Sonna was nominated for the Dutch Design Award with his project of  “Sunshine after Rain” in collaboration with the Eindhoven Hatshop. During 2009 en 2010, Sonna also realized the project “Attribute of Tomorrow” in collaboration with the Djenne Foundation. This project focused on child-soldiers in Mali, asking questions about the terrible choices and realities these children had to face. Another collaborative  project was “True Colours”, in which Sonna gave underprivileged women in Mali the opportunity to develop their artistic skills and talents

profile_positions.description:
Exhibitions | selection

Dakar Biennale 2022 : ECHO
We carry our individual pasts with us wherever we go, “pasts” directly influence our present.
Echo incorporates this concept and tries to show it in in a new and different light.

July 2020 - January 2022
Exhibition '1525' Van Abbemuseum, The Netherlands
The exhibition title is a play on the number 152. A single five is added: one of the first transatlantic transports of enslaved people took place in 1525.   

September 2017 - If It Was My Imagination [Art Berlin]
If It Was My Imagination shows how perished glory can be transformed into a new narrative. If you close the door, development will shut down.New objects arise from various old and found parts, showing my reflections on the idea that all forms, materials and functions of objects are rooted in an earlier usage or another life. These objects are a reaction to perfection and mass production: a reflection on scarcity and abundance.

October 2017 - Next Nature 
Day to day reality forced me to improvise , combining all kinds of materials in new ways and 
creating new objects in the process.Everything around us is in flux and nothing is absolutely fixed. This causes everything we experience as being secure, to be actually very transitory and volatile.

October 2016 - Anatomy of Identity [Van Abbemuseum]
Anatomy of Identity is about the toll-taking return of that which has been pushed away. It investigates the effects of opposing and colliding patterns on identity, translating this into works which have become disturbed and disturbing not only as far as their form is concerned but also with regard to their function and use. Perhaps we are all designers who sometimes form and shape the world while being shaped and formed by it at another time.
